text: Russell William Bannock (born Bahnuk; November 1, 1919 â€“ January 4, 2020) was a Canadian Air Force fighter ace during the Second World War. He was a chief test pilot for de Havilland Canada. He was born in Edmonton, Alberta. In 2011, he was made a member of the Order of Ontario "for his contributions to the aerospace industry". Bannock died on January 4, 2020 at the age of 100.Remembering aviation legend Russell Bannock ==References== ==Other websites== * Russ Bannock at acesofww2.com * Hall of Fame site Category:1919 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Canadian autobiographers Category:Aviators Category:Canadian centenarians Category:Canadian military personnel of World War II Category:People from Edmonton
title: Russell Bannock
